bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, February 8, 1900

div1.p: Lazear provides travel details and reports that his son is well.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, February 8, 1900
div1.opener:
DR. JESSE W. LAZEAR,
835 PARK AVE.
OFFICE HOURS,
4.30-6 P. M.
BALTIMORE. Feb 8, 1900
My dear Mother,-
div1.p:
We are approaching Tampa.
Our train was delayed in the night by
a freight wreck ahead, so we
shall not reach Tampa until midnight
instead of 10 oclock, Houston has
got along very well so far.

He sleeps well in spite of the
noise.

Another thing I forgot to attend to
was paying for the “Sun”. They
will probably send a bill to me.

Florida is disappointing. I remembered
it as a sort of fairy-land. But I
suppose that was one of the enthusiasm
of youth.
div1.closer:
Your affectionate Son.
P.S. I left a lot of drugs on the Chiffonier.
Please pack them away in the store-room.
